titleStmt.title: J. A. Duncan et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4437

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Tho E Bramlette Governor of the State of Kentucky

Your petitioners would represent that at the May term 1860 of the Owen Circuit The Commonwealth of Kentucky obtained a judgment against G W Suter under an indictment for "Suffering gaming on his premises" for the Sum of $20000 and costs of the prosecution
Said judgment has not yet been paid and a caprias has been issued thereon under which said Suter is likely to be incarcerated in jail for nonpayment

We are well acquainted with Mr Suter_ he is a man of limited means with a family dependent on him for a Support_ he is a good citizen and a quiet and law abiding man_ To compel him to pay this fine would place him and his family in much trouble and we cheerfully say that we consider this a very fit subject for Executive clemency. We therefore most respectfully ask that said fine may be remitted Given under our hands this 14th day of November 1863

J A Duncan
Corwin Claxon
John H. Lawler
W. P. Buen
J B Mchatten
Joseph Rinoele
J W BossEmiser
Thos. A. Benjamin
Tho N Lindsey
